The Foxtrot Fanatics

Who Are We?

We are a small team of about three to four consistent members, and we’re committed to preserving Code Lyoko in the best quality possible. With the usage of kick-ass deep-learning algorithms and cold hard sweat, we will bring you the finest premium USDA-approved viewing experience for Code Lyoko you’ve ever laid eyes on. With all the fixings—subtitles, multiple audio tracks, and bonus features, we can find or make, just like a shiny new DVD or Blu-ray Disc.

Jokes aside, this project was originally created by Christian77777 in late March of 2017 to improve his home server collection of Code Lyoko. This, however, started to turn into a group effort when he asked for help from Alex who had access to higher-end hardware that would quicken the process of improving the video quality. Christian realized other fans of the show would probably enjoy his efforts, so he made a call for help to the Code Lyoko subreddit to provide him with media required to create a meaningful remaster of the show. A humble but determined group of subtitlers and programmers formed, and we decided to name ourselves the Foxtrot Fanatics.

What Are We Doing?

Previous Next

Upscaling Project

Locating the best original video source for the show

Crafting a custom automated program for the upscaling process called FoxTrotUpscaler™ (trademark pending)

Upscaling PAL 576i 25 FPS material to 1440p 25 FPS via FTU (4:3 aspect ratio)

Muxing the audio and subtitles with the completed renders

Transcription Project

Transcribing all four seasons of Code Lyoko (mostly by hand, since YouTube's automatic captions are generally bad)

Creating timed subtitles based on the completed transcripts.

All of this will be done on the original episodes, from episode 1 to episode 95 as well as the two prequel episodes, and possibly a select few other videos at the discretion and will of the team.

We will not be performing any work on any other CL works, namely Evolution.

"How Can I Get Involved?"

More than anything right now, we could use people with the time and willingness to assist with the transcription process. This is the part that takes a lot of time, but we still want to do it if at all possible, because we know that fans worldwide would love to have them for various reasons.

No previous background experience is required to become a transcriber. All you need is a few hours out of the week, a keyboard, a computer that can play vide, and a willingness to lend a hand. We will fill you in on everything else that you need to know to get the job done once you're ready.

If you happen to have any background knowledge in the art of digital video and feel that you would like to contribute here, you can also contact us as help would also be appreciated here.

Of course, if you've thought of something that we haven't listed here or have anything that you would like to contribute, feel free to contact us with those suggestions in hand.

Where Can You Find Our Work?

We have partnered up with The Code Lyoko Archives to be able to bring you all of our hard work, at no cost to you!
